data.title: Display members of a file in explorer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great to drill down to members of a component within the explorer tree or in an outline view of the selected file. This is extremely useful when you have many objects in one file and you're struggling to find that one function that you need to finish a task. See below for example from VS:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3504712/18017173/4275f9de-6b9e-11e6-8b65-0143b5143fc9.png)

data.title: Test: QuickOpen file search
data.body:
- [x] Windows **@bpasero**
- [x] OS X **@kieferrm**
- [x] Linux **@aeschli**

Testing QuickOpen's file search for regressions from #55.

Functionality:
- [ ] Search term is fuzzy matched to file names in the workspace
- [ ] "files.exclude" and "search.exclude" settings are applied
  - [ ] except for absolute file paths
  - [ ] except for workspace relative file paths
- [ ] Adding/removing files/folders is reflected in the QuickOpen results the next time it is opened
  - Full disclosure: At first results can be served from an old cache, further typing will switch to an updated cache when available

Corner-cases:
- [ ] Circular symlinks and symlinks in general
- [ ] Mounted network drives
- [ ] Network paths (Windows only?)
- [ ] Folders that contain files/folders that need permission elevation to access
- [ ] Folders with > 255 characters on Windows
- [ ] Files/folders with non-ascii characters in their names etc.

data.title: cannot set a font included '+' in a name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install a font include '+' in a name; for example, I tried ["Rounded Mgen+ 1mn medium"](http://jikasei.me/font/rounded-mgenplus/) ( Japanese ).
2. run the VSCode and open the `settings.json`
3. set the font; for example, to set `"editor.fontFamily": "Rounded Mgen+ 1mn medium"`.
4. save the `settings.json` and repro( the font will be not applied ).

data.title: Line breaks in JSDocs/Markdown comments render inconsistent space in Intellisense boxes.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

If I have a JSDocs header like this:

```
/**
 * @summary Does something.
 * @description This is a long description. In code, this description can get pretty long,
 * so I will break it up into multiple lines for easier reading.
 * - Example bullet
 * - Example bullet
 *
 * @returns A value.
 * 
 */
```

VS Code's Intellisense box renders it like this:

> `@`summary Does something.
> `@`description This is a long description. In code, this description can get
> pretty long,
> so I will break it up into multiple lines for easier reading.
> - Example bullet
> - Example bullet
> 
> ` `
> 
> @returns A value.
> function ...

When I'm expecting something more like this:

> Does something.
> 
> This is a long description. In code, this description can get
> pretty long, so I will break it up into multiple lines for
> easier reading.
> - Example bullet
> - Example bullet
> 
> @returns A value.
> 
> function ...

data.title: Automatic update fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 
- Note: I'm logged on as a "standard" user and need to logon as administrator to install
1. I received the notification for a new version (1.4.0)
2. Quit and restarted VS Code
3. …still running the same version.
4. There was never any dialog asking for my password nor the administrator password

Had to download the app from the web and manually replace the old version.

data.title: Multiple selections: disable context detection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to reproduce:

Example code:

``` JavaScript
<script>
var testVar1 = "<CURSOR>";
var testVar2 = <CURSOR>;
</script>
```
1. Set language to JavaScript.
2. Place two cursors at `<CURSOR>`
3. Enter something like `\"sometext\"`
4. You end up with

``` JavaScript
<script>
var testVar1 = "\"sometext\";
var testVar2 = \"sometext\";
</script>
```

This may not be the best example, but it shows that typing with multiple cursors has the potential to not do what the user expects (the entered text being the same at all cursor locations) and break things. I think other editors work around this by disabling the context detection when there are multiple cursors.

data.title: Test: contribute actions to folders in the explorer
data.body:
- [x] any OS **@alexandrudima**

In #10433 we introduced a new context key `explorerResourceIsFolder`  that extension writers can use to contribute actions to folders in the explorer
- Write an extension and verify you can add a functional action to a folder in the explorer

data.title: Search Viewlet does not select text in editor when replace is revealed
data.body:
If the Replace field is not revealed, clicking on a search result selects the found text in the editor. This is what I expect.

If the Replace field is revealed, clicking on a search result does not select the found text in the editor. This is unexpected.

It also leaves behind a decoration when moving the selection away.

![search-viewlet-weird](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/18007034/a2249684-6ba2-11e6-955f-4d5ca21fe223.gif)

data.title: Test: Configuration and environment service cleanup
data.body:
- [x] win **@isidorn**
- [x] os x **@weinand**
- [x] Linux **@joaomoreno**

In order to work on extension API for configuration management, quite some debt in `configuration` land and `environment` handling (cli) was removed and lots of code refactored. We should make sure that we did not introduce regressions while doing so in the areas touched:
- All our command line arguments passed to VS Code work as before and work for either no instance running or an existing instance running
- You can install extensions from the command line
- User settings are being picked up and apply live throughout the UI
- Workspace settings are being picked up and apply live throughout the UI
- Debug an extension and verify the extension settings it defines are picked up properly within the extension

As per feature request #444, you can now configure VS Code to keep quick open visible even when focus moves out of it.
- Verify you can configure this option and quick open remains usable as before and stays open on focus lost
- Verify you can always close quick open with the ESC key

As per feature request #5565, you can now configure VS Code to save all dirty files when switching windows.

data.title: Support committing the selected completion item with keys like `(`
Cannot rename class reference used within the class itself (JavaScript)
It should be possible to lookup global symbols without openning an editor
Issues with the Find box
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps:
First of all, thank you for this good editor. It's nice and I enjoy using it.
The Find box has some minor issues:
Suppose you want to search for a certain phrase and make some modifications near that phrase.
Eg: Consider this text:

```
x = process("cat");
y = process("mouse")
... ...
z = process("dog");
...
```

Say you want to change it to this:

```
x = process($("cat").getId());
y = process($("mouse").getId());
... ...
z = process($("dog").getId());
...
```

(for whatever reason),

You'd hit Ctrl+F and type in "process" in the Find box. 
Problem 1) Once it highlights the first occurrence of the word 'process', the Escape key does not close that Find box. I have to visually locate the highlighted word, and take my mouse to click near that word and position my cursor there.
Continuing with the example, I reach `x = process("cat");` and position my cursor after the opening curve bracket `(` and type in `$(` and then move to the `"` following `cat` and type in `).getId()` to change it to `x = process($("cat").getId());`. 
Then, to avoid typing in `).getId()` again, I select the word `).getId()` that I just typed, copy it and then I want to continue my search for `process`.
Problem 2) There's no way to continue my previous search now. Hitting Ctrl+F while this is selected automatically overwrites my Find box's contents `process` with `).getId()`. There should be a switch to disable this behavior.
Problem 3) The Next Match and Previous Match arrows on the Find box don't work. Clicking them doesn't do anything. There aren't any keyboard shortcuts on them either.
Problem 4) The find box shows a misleading "No Results" in red background even when it actually finds some results and highlights them.

data.title: No Intellisense available
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:41:29.513Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

For some reason Intellisense does not seem to work anymore. It broke at some point. Unknown when or where the first occurrence was.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Remove Visual Studio Code
2. remove any lingering files as described on http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/225055/app-files-on-mac-os-x-visual-studio-code
3. Reinstall Visual Studio Code and add PowerShell ext (v.0.7.1)
4. Open a PowerShell script, only to discover that Intellisense is not working for me.

M.

data.title: Implement User Setting to Allow Customizing Default Size of New Windows.
data.body: Basically as the title says, to have some "window.defaultSize" setting to allow customizing the default size of new windows. Currently the default size is not ideal for some people, this would allow those users to customize it to their preference.

data.title: Mulitline copy/pasting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. shift+alt to get multicursors on several lines
2. ctrl+x to cut
3. ctrl+c to paste
